root: ^The Debate Club was quiet other than the students watching the ongoing debate. One student had stood out to you, and that was the one that had a very baggy green jumper.
^They were very bold and firm, slamming down their opponents mercilessly as the debates went on. They definitely peaked your interest.
^You had approached them after the debate had ended and the club was packing up for the day and they stared at you, raising an eyebrow.
^Holding a water bottle in one hand, they had stared at you expectantly.
^They asked with a snarky tone in their voice. It sort of surprised you and it influenced how you responded to them.

Ignore: ^Their eyes narrowed, shining with impatience. They clearly do not want to speak to you.
^That seemed to have caught their attention and they stopped what they were doing, attentive eyes looking all over you. They looked as if they were waiting for a catch.
^Their voice was barely over a mumble, posture loosening. Now, they looked at your eyes with no anger or impatience. They seemed like a whole new person.
Nice: ^Their eyes narrowed, shining with impatience. They clearly do not want to speak to you.
^You said sweetly, seeing how their expression turned more deadpan as the seconds go by
^???: "Stop being fake nice to me it's annoying."
^They interrupted, huffing as they swung their bag on their shoulder. You stared, instantly frowning. So much for being nice.
Rude: ^Their eyes narrowed, shining with impatience. They clearly do not want to speak to you.
^Her voice came out like a warning, looking genuinely pissed.
^This person seemed to be very impatient so you wasted no time and
^. I need some volunteers for my last essay in Philosophy, and I was wondering if you'd be interested in being one?"
^They had blinked a few times before sighing at you.
^???: "You're asking me, a random person you don't know at all who you've seen in a debate once, to take apart in a random research paper?"
Choice: ^You said matter of factly. They just looked at you, an unreadable expression on their face, before they looked awkwardly to the side. It was evident that they felt embarrassed.
^They replied so slowly, hand covering their mouth as they looked away. It was time to change the topic, you thought
GoodPoint: ^You thought for a moment when she pointed that out, suddenly seeing things from her perspective and seeing how rushed you were being with this. Looking away, you sighed.
^You: "However, I still think you'd be good candidate for my essay."
^All they did was sigh, nodding as they looked back at you. You took that as a positive sign
Mistake: ^Once she pointed out what you were doing it sounded sort of absurd. With a crumbling resolve, you nodded hesitantly.
^They had rolled their eyes at you with a sigh.
^???: "I needed to check if you were serious about this. Seriously, grow some balls."
^???: "Fine, I'll be one of your candidates..."
^You stared at them in surprise. You didn't think you had convinced them well enough, yet here they are agreeing to participate.
^You let your surprise seep through your response to them and they raised a brow at you.
^They added on with a shrug. Ahh, you thought, that makes sense.
^Genesis: "My name is Genesis by the way."
^With a soft and friendly smile, you said,
^With that you had give them the first question for your essay. They hummed in thought as if they were already wondering how to answer it which made you a bit relieved.
^You had said goodbye to them after you made sure they knew how to answer it, and went on your way.
